choices.A: Install the Paramiko library on the host that runs Ansible
choices.D: Comment out the StrictHostKeyChecking=yes line from ansible.cfg
choices.B: Generate a new SSH key pair and add the public key to the target machine

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct, D isn't because the default value is 'yes', so commenting that line out still results in the same error

questions.question_text: What are two testing scenarios of the chaos engineering principle? (Choose two.)

choices.A: maxing out CPU cores on an Elasticsearch duster
choices.C: executing routine in driver code to emulate I/O errors
choices.B: removing all users from a version control system

discussion.content:
Both B and D are nonsense that can be eliminated:
B. removing all users from a version control system
D. blocking developers’ building access

Tha leaves A, C, E:
A. maxing out CPU cores on an Elasticsearch duster
- A sounds correct, except that the Elasticsearch cluster is typically used for logging/monitoring (I could be wrong on this), which would not be the usual target for chaos engineering.
C. executing routine in driver code to emulate I/O errors
- C might be correct, if it is about actually introducing errors into the 
E. unplugging a core switch device
- I feel pretty confident about E, that this would validate that the traffic could route around the core switch.
My guess is C & E, although maybe it's A & E

Selected Answer: AC
Maybe A & C?

Selected Answer: C
The whole network is at risk.

questions.question_text:
A security team is running vulnerability scans against a CI/CD pipeline. The reports show that RDBMS secrets were found hardcoded in Ansible scripts. The RDBMS resides in the internal network but is accessible from a jump server that resides in a public network.

If an attacker gains access to the scripts, what is the risk exposure?

choices.A: The Automation server is at risk of being compromised.
choices.D: The entire CI/CD-related infrastructure is at risk.
choices.B: The Ansible scripts run through encrypted SSH connections.
choices.C: The internal network is at risk of being compromised.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A developer must create a GitLab CI/CD pipeline with these requirements:
• builds an on-demand test environment
• deploys configurations
• verifies the results

Drag and drop the code from the bottom onto the box where the code is missing to complete the GitLab CI/CD pipeline. Not all options are used.

//IMG//

choices.D: Replicate the production environment in the pipeline before applying
choices.B: Manually deploy the change into the production environment

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Production env and the company's env is different in this case.

questions.question_text:
A company has a CI/CD pipeline implemented to automate application deployment. An urgent change is required in the production environment. A developer produces and tests the required change in the company's environment, but the pipeline fails when pushed.

Which action conforms to the rules of a CI/CD pipeline and enables the pipeline to pass?
